title: (x) Spruce Magazine - custom font by Fidel Peugeot {Fabio}
content:
Hello folks,   
What is this font used in Spruce magazine? Looks like a knock-off of Bauhaus??   
 ![SpruceMag](http://web.archive.org/web/20111210174708im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/18540.gif)
author: skyrocket

comments.content:
This is custom made by Fidel {Mr. Lomofonts ;D} Peugeot!   
   
See here:   
 [http://www.rgb107-6.com/rgb107\_6/rgb/modern/\_html/spruce4.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20111210174708/http:/www.rgb107-6.com/rgb107_6/rgb/modern/_html/spruce4.html)   
   
and here:   
 [http://www.rgb107-6.com/rgb107\_6/rgb/modern/\_html/spruce5.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20111210174708/http:/www.rgb107-6.com/rgb107_6/rgb/modern/_html/spruce5.html)

Thanks Fabio! That's amazing font detective work. I would have never found that. Yves - you get a merit award too ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20111210174708im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
Regards   
PAUL

I think it's just a matter of time till we find this.   
In the meantime, take a look at [Tschicholina](http://web.archive.org/web/20111210174708/http:/www.type-o-tones.com/p_fonts/p_tschi.htm) and   
 [Bayer Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20111210174708/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/victory/bayer-sans/).

I E-mailed Fidel Peugeot thanks to this thread. I contacted him because I was looking for a fashion editorial that featured a girl in a fur parka. It was either in SPRUCE or LINE, I couldn't remember which. (LINE & Spruce being 2 Wallpaper\* spin-offs from the early 200's).

I thought such a weird request would easily be ignored.

But guess what? He still has a copy of the first issue of LINE magazine! And snapped a pic!

[http://i48.tinypic.com/2d8kp35.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20111210174708/http:/i48.tinypic.com/2d8kp35.jpg "http://i48.tinypic.com/2d8kp35.jpg")

That's right! The girl in the fur parka!
Now this was a strange response. But apparently a happy one. Go fur parka!
